author: Christy Cabrera Chirinos
title: Hurricanes basketball teams unveil new uniforms, Motley honored
text:
Both of the Hurricanes basketball teams have high expectations going into the season.
And on Thursday afternoon, at an invitation-only event for some of Miami’s top donors, the teams unveiled three of the new looks they’ll wear this season as each bids to return to the NCAA Tournament.
The Hurricanes will have orange, white and green uniforms designed by the school’s new apparel partner, Adidas, with some alternate looks likely being unveiled later in the season.
According to a release from Miami, the uniforms feature the “Hurricanes” nickname etched across the jersey’s shoulder for players to see as they put the uniform on. They are made of the same lightweight material used in Adidas’ NBA jerseys and the school says the uniforms have “targeted ventilation zones on the chest, back, and side” designed to keep players cool.
Along with seeing the new uniforms – which were modeled by basketball players Angel Rodriguez, Tonye Jekiri, Sheldon McClellan, Jessica Thomas, Michelle Woods and Adrienne Motley – the donors also got to watch both teams practice and hear from athletic director Blake James as well as coaches Jim Larrañaga and Katie Meier.
Miami’s men’s team is coming off a 25-13 season which culminated in a run to the National Invitation Tournament championship game. The women, meanwhile, went 20-13 and advanced to the second round of the NCAA Tournament.
“It’s a really exciting time,” Meier said. “Both Coach L and I, we’ve got a little bit of a pep in our step when you see us in the halls and you see us at our practices. We’re teaching, but they’re listening and they’re learning. They’re applying the concepts very early. I’ve watched their practices, they’re amazingly sharp right now and they return so much talent. The pace of my practice, I’m about six practices ahead of where I normally am this time of year which excites me.”
The two teams will play exhibition games on Nov. 4 at the BankUnited Center with the women facing Nova Southeastern at 4 p.m. and the men taking on Dowling at 7 p.m.
Motley honored
Motley, a junior guard, was named a preseason All-ACC pick earlier this week by both the conference’s coaches and Blue Ribbon Panel. Motley, who averaged 16.9 points, 4.2 rebounds, 2.1 assists and 1.4 steals last season, was the lone player to rank in the top 15 among ACC players in scoring, field goal percentage, 3-point percentage and free throw percentage.
She was a first-team All-ACC pick last season and was named the ESPNW National Player of the Week after she had a career-high 32 points in Miami’s win over then fourth-ranked Notre Dame last January.
